subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text: * {{l|mul|⽔}} (U+2F54, Kangxi radical) * {{l|mul|氵}} (when used as a left radical) * {{l|mul|氺}} (when used in characters such as {{l|mul|泰}})

subSections.text:

* {{l|mul|[[尿]], [[𤆩]], [[𤆲]]}} <!-- Characters not found under radical index of 水 -->

subSections.title: Etymology 1
subSections.text:
From {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*lwi(j)||flow; stream}} ({{zh-ref|Benedict, 1974}}; {{zh-ref|Coblin, 1986}}; {{zh-ref|Handel, 1998}}; {{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}; STEDT). Cognate with {{cog|lus|lui||stream; brook; river}}, {{cog|ctd|tr=luːi³|t=stream; river}}, {{cog|kac|lawi||to flow (as water)}}.

{{cog|och|-}} {{och-l|水|tr=lhuiʔ}} (minimally reconstructed) is {{cog|sit|-}} root's endoactive derivation with suffix ''*-ʔ'', meaning "that which is flowing"; its voiceless initial suggests the presence of a nominalizing prefix ''*k-'' or ''*s-''. Another derivative from the {{cog|sit|-}} root is possibly {{och-l|泫|tr=winʔ|to flow}} (minimally reconstructed).

Compare also areal etymon {{cog|mkh-pro|*lujʔ ~ luuj() ~ luəj() ~ ləəj()||to wade; to swim}}.

subSections.title: Readings
Compounds
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{wp|lang=ja}} {{wp|Water}}
{{ja-kanjitab|みず|yomi=k}} {{IPAfont|⟨mi1du⟩}} → *{{IPAchar|/mʲidu/}} → {{IPAchar|/mid͡zu/}} → {{IPAchar|/mizu/}} From {{inh|ja|ojp|sort=みず|-}}, from {{inh|ja|jpx-pro|*mentu}}. Cognate with {{cog|jpx-ryu-pro|*mezu}} (whence {{cog|tkn|むぃずぃ|tr={{IPAchar|/mɨdzɨ/}}}}, {{cog|ryu|みじ|tr={{IPAchar|/midʑi/}} → miji}}, {{cog|mvi|みず|tr=midzɿ}} and {{cog|yoi|みん|tr={{IPAchar|/miɴ/}} → min}}). Also {{cog|zkg|買|tr=*me|t=[[river]], [[water]]}} is suspected to be a relative.{{cite-web|first=Alexander|last=Vovin|authorlink=Alexander Vovin|year=2010|title=上代日本語と古代・中世韓国語の「水」と「涙」|work=日韓言語学者会議 : 韓国語を通じた日韓両国の相互理解と共生|url=https://doctiktak.com/e7fbb28f49f91a656a039397a6b7e65b79623.html|page=115}} Possibly cognate with {{m|ja|瑞|tr={{IPAfont|⟨mi1du⟩}} → mizu||[[freshness]], [[youth]]}}.

subSections.text: * Most dictionaries [[proscribe]] historical ''-uwi'' readings such as {{ja-r|す.ゐ|hist=1}}, {{ja-r|ず.ゐ|hist=1}}, {{ja-r|つ.ゐ|hist=1}}, {{ja-r|ゆ.ゐ|hist=1}}, and {{ja-r|る.ゐ|hist=1}} as attested in many historical documents.

subSections.text: * [http://language.psy.auckland.ac.nz/austronesian/language.php?id=761 ABVD: Mulam of Dongmen] and [http://language.psy.auckland.ac.nz/austronesian/language.php?id=936 of Siba]

subSections.title: Compounds
Etymology
subSections.text: From earlier 水 (みづ, midzu/midu), attested in 1711 in the Konkoukenshuu (混効験集). The word underwent a pronunciation change due to the shifting of /u/ to /i/ after alveolar consonants. Cognate with mainland {{cog|ja|水|tr=mizu}}, {{cog|ojp|-}} {{m|ja|水|tr=midu}}.

subSections.title: Derived terms
Han character
Compounds
Etymology
subSections.text: Cognate with mainland {{cog|ja|水|tr=mizu}}, {{cog|ojp|-}} {{m|ja|水|tr=midu}}. Possibly also related to {{cog|ko|-}} {{ko-l|물||water}}, {{cog|okm|밀|tr=mil||water}}.

subSections.title: References
subSections.text:
* ''The Languages of Japan and Korea'' (2012), section ''Yonaguni'', page 415 (as ''miɴ'')

[[Category:yoi:Water|みん]]

subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text: Cognate with mainland {{cog|ja|水|tr=mizu}}, {{cog|ojp|-}} {{m|ja|水|tr=midu}}. Possibly also related to {{cog|ko|-}} {{ko-l|물||water}}, {{cog|okm|밀|tr=mil||water}}.
